item.title: Real-time Transport Data Visualization with GTFS
item.content:encoded:
For real-time transport data visualization, there is a standard called GTFS built on top of Protocol Buffers.

GTFS stands for General Transit Feed Specification

It consists of two main parts: GTFS Schedule and GTFS Realtime.

item.title: Asset hashing with webpack
item.content:encoded:
Why would you hash your assets?

If you're creating a website that has a caching layer sitting in front of it, you're going to need a way to bust the cache every time you make a release so your cache doesn't continue to serve up your old files.
item.author: me@madole.dev (Andrew McDowell)

item.content:encoded:
Webpack's Provide Plugin allows you to set up variables that get injected into your code when they are used in your codebase.

This means that if I want to polyfill the new ES6 native promise for older browsers, I can do it at build time.
